data.title: Jade's 'Angel Of My Dreams': Five Key Details
data.meta_description: Jade's 'Angel Of My Dreams' sent the internet into meltdown, with an intricate video that offered throwbacks to different aspects of her career. Out now,
data.meta_site_name: Clash Magazine Music News, Reviews & Interviews
data.text:
Jade’s ‘Angel Of My Dreams’ sent the internet into meltdown, with an intricate video that offered throwbacks to different aspects of her career.

Out now, the song is a bold solo statement, one that allows Jade Thirwall to wipe the slate clean, and move beyond her role in record-breaking girl group Little Mix. She told BBC Newsbeat recently: “I’m ready to give some pop girlie drama”.

Praising ‘Angel Of My Dreams’, CLASH said of the single:

Self-described as “a huge pop punch to the face” this is a single that out-paces both her former band mates and much of her UK peers – in a pop landscape that is increasingly safe, and void of experimentation, Jade has graffitied her name all across the rule book.

The full video was shot by director Aube Perrie and it contains some key Easter eggs – here’s five…

—

—

Jade’s scarf is a callback to her South Shields roots

In the opening scene Jade is seen walking around East London, with a maroon football scarf on. Naturally, many immediately leaped to the conclusion that it must be nearby West Ham United – but they’d be wrong.

The scarf is actually South Shields FC, where Jade is one of the club’s honorary Presidents – alongside former local MP David Miliband, believe it or not.

Her X Factor audition gets a reference

Little Mix were famously an X Factor success story, an example of the talent show getting the mixture right, and providing a platform for those talents to flourish. Not one to miss a trick, Jade goes back to where it all began, and mixes this audition tape with footage of her performing as a child.

The home video footage is slightly tweaked, however – she’s shown performing her debut solo single, ‘Angel Of My Dreams’.

The Jade Room gets a shout-out

Jade recently launched an online space for fans to congregate, called – ingeniously – The Jade Room. A tongue-in-cheek flip of the Shade Room, it’s become a ready-made community, an example of the internet at its most creative, and positive.

The reporters in one scene are shown using microphones emblazoned with the Jade Room logo.

There’s a meaning to the chip shop

In one scene, Jade is shown eating a box of chips in the street. Shot in East London, the shop behind her is actually Perfect Fried Chicken, a local chain with branches dotted around Hackney.

The box, however, is quite different – it references Colman’s fish and chips, a chain of fish and chips restaurants in the seaside town of South Shields.

WTF is Grian Chatten doing here?

Yep, that really is Fontaines D.C. frontman Grian Chatten in the background, wearing a lime green tracksuit, and later some angel wings. But how – in the words of David Byrne – did he get here…?

As it transpires, director Aube Perrie also worked on Fontaines D.C. video ‘Starburster’ – and if you look closely in that video, you’ll also see Jade Thirwall in the background.

So, he’s simply repaying the favour – and it’s sent fans into a tizzy.

—
